text: The S&P 500 closed up 1.2% today driven by strong tech earnings.
NVIDIA reported earnings that beat expectations by 15%, sending the stock up 8% after hours.
Meanwhile, the Federal Reserve signaled they may hold rates steady at the next meeting.
Bond yields dropped 10 basis points on the news, with the 10-year treasury now at 4.1%.
In crypto news, Bitcoin surged past 50,000 dollars for the first time this year.
Analysts attribute the rally to increased institutional adoption and ETF inflows.
Looking ahead, key economic data includes tomorrow's jobs report.
Economists expect 180,000 jobs added, which could influence Fed policy decisions.
